intro: Tetranthera leiantha, commonly known as the white sand caryophyll, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, well-drained environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Tetranthera leiantha is often found in open habitats such as savannas and forest edges.
